reviewText: Amazing product teaches with scientific knowledge breaking down how different stretches and techniques work. I train in American Muay Thai and I have seen my round houses increase by 6 to 12 inches in one month, when sparring I felt fluid and limber and had great success.
Great exercises ; but for most of them you need special equipment or access to a gym. But there is no doubt that after several week you will be strong enough to do the isometrics and then the splits.
The tape was in perfect condition. In both audio & visual quality. I couldn't be any more happier with it, thanks.

I also have the companion book, "Stretching scientifically" and I am quite pleased. I've been taking Taekwondo since the mid 1980's, and my flexibility has been stagnant for most of that time. I've noticed continuous incremental improvement since applying the principles contained in this DVD (and book) and expect to see them continue. Thanks!
Not worth the price. Good information, Solid program. I just think the price is way too high. Read the table of contents and save yourself some $

My problem this dvd is there isn't a variety of stretches.  Some stretches have to be performed in a gym setting or with a boflex.  The difference with the levels of exercise (easy to hard) is only the amount of reps and weights that you put on your legs.  The dvd menu was hard to navigate and it was visually hard to see what was highlighted and what wasn't.  This is not to say that the stretches wouldn't work, it just that I'm not willing to ever watch it again.
